conclusion: Understanding how position and size of shadows change with light source movement
Light source initially positioned above objects casting shadows A, B, C, and D
Shadows are projections of objects onto the ground
Moving light source backward increases distance from objects affecting shadow size and position
Decreased angle of incidence results in smaller shadows further from objects
Shadows move farther from objects due to longer light path and decreased incidence angle
Shadows become smaller as light spreads over larger ground area
Initial image shows shadows A, B, C, and D close to objects
Second image shows shadows A', B', C', and D' farther and smaller
Final answer: Shadows move farther and become smaller when light source moves backward
